text: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

text: Beauty is everywhere a welcome guest.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

text: Beauty, n: the power by which a woman charms a lover and terrifies a husband.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: Dear God! how beauty varies in nature and art. In a woman the flesh must be like marble in a statue the marble must be like flesh.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Beauty doesn't need ornaments. Softness can't bear the weight of ornaments.
author: Munshi Premchand

text: Beauty is in the heart of the beholder.
author: H. G. Wells

text: Let us live for the beauty of our own reality.
author: Charles Lamb

text: Every year of my life I grow more convinced that it is wisest and best to fix our attention on the beautiful and the good, and dwell as little as possible on the evil and the false.
author: Richard Cecil

text: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting.
author: Charles Kingsley

text: Beauty is the promise of happiness.
author: Edmund Burke

text: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: Imagination disposes of everything it creates beauty, justice, and happiness, which are everything in this world.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: A women's greatest asset is her beauty.
author: Alex Comfort

text: Beauty is indeed a good gift of God but that the good may not think it a great good, God dispenses it even to the wicked.
author: Saint Augustine

text: Beauty is power a smile is its sword.
author: John Ray

text: Beauty itself is but the sensible image of the Infinite.
author: Francis Bacon

text: If you look closely at a tree you'll notice it's knots and dead branches, just like our bodies. What we learn is that beauty and imperfection go together wonderfully.
author: Matthew Fox

text: Beauty is ever to the lonely mind a shadow fleeting she is never plain. She is a visitor who leaves behind the gift of grief, the souvenir of pain.
author: Christopher Morley

text: Beauty is only temporary, but your mind lasts you a lifetime.
author: Alicia Machado

text: Beauty is a fragile gift.
author: Ovid

text: Beauty saves. Beauty heals. Beauty motivates. Beauty unites. Beauty returns us to our origins, and here lies the ultimate act of saving, of healing, of overcoming dualism.
author: Matthew Fox

text: In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.
author: Christopher Morley

text: Love built on beauty, soon as beauty, dies.
author: John Donne

text: I don't need plastic in my body to validate me as a woman.
author: Courtney Love

text: I gave my beauty and my youth to men. I am going to give my wisdom and experience to animals.
author: Brigitte Bardot

text: The problem with beauty is that it's like being born rich and getting poorer.
author: Joan Collins

text: In youth and beauty, wisdom is but rare!
author: Homer

text: Heat cannot be separated from fire, or beauty from The Eternal.
author: Dante Alighieri

text: Having inner beauty is something you develop on your own, and I like to think I have that.
author: Cindy Margolis

text: Beauty is less important than quality.
author: Eugene Ormandy

text: There is a kind of beauty in imperfection.
author: Conrad Hall

text: When virtue and modesty enlighten her charms, the lustre of a beautiful woman is brighter than the stars of heaven, and the influence of her power it is in vain to resist.
author: Akhenaton

text: Beauty is variable, ugliness is constant.
author: Douglas Horton

text: 'Handsome' means many things to many people. If people consider me handsome, I feel flattered - and have my parents to thank for it. Realistically, it doesn't hurt to be good-looking, especially in this business.
author: Richard Chamberlain

text: My mother always called me an ugly weed, so I never was aware of anything until I was older. Plain girls should have someone telling them they are beautiful. Sometimes this works miracles.
author: Hedy Lamarr

text: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.
author: Christian Dior

text: Beauty is our weapon against nature by it we make objects, giving them limit, symmetry, proportion. Beauty halts and freezes the melting flux of nature.
author: Camille Paglia

text: Beauty is whatever gives joy.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

text: There is no personal achievement in being born beautiful.
author: Loretta Young

text: The love of beauty in its multiple forms is the noblest gift of the human cerebrum.
author: Alexis Carrel

text: Beauty is the first present nature gives to women and the first it takes away.
author: Fay Weldon

text: Some guys say beauty is only skin deep. But when you walk into a party, you don't see somebody's brain. The initial contact has to be the sniffing.
author: James Caan

text: We are learning, too, that the love of beauty is one of Nature's greatest healers.
author: Ellsworth Huntington

text: I sincerely feel that beauty largely comes from within.
author: Christy Turlington

text: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.
author: Maria Mitchell

text: Even in the centuries which appear to us to be the most monstrous and foolish, the immortal appetite for beauty has always found satisfaction.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: You can only perceive real beauty in a person as they get older.
author: Anouk Aimee

text: Inner beauty should be the most important part of improving one's self.
author: Priscilla Presley

text: What beauty is, I know not, though it adheres to many things.
author: Albrecht Durer

text: Though beauty gives you a weird sense of entitlement, it's rather frightening and threatening to have others ascribe such importance to something you know you're just renting for a while.
author: Candice Bergen

text: Things are beautiful if you love them.
author: Jean Anouilh

text: The real sin against life is to abuse and destroy beauty, even one's own even more, one's own, for that has been put in our care and we are responsible for its well-being.
author: Katherine Anne Porter

text: Real beauty knocks you a little bit off kilter.
author: David Byrne

text: Integrity reveals beauty.
author: Thomas Leonard

text: If you get simple beauty and naught else, you get about the best thing God invents.
author: Robert Browning

text: Goodness is beauty in the best estate.
author: Christopher Marlowe

text: Our hearts were drunk with a beauty Our eyes could never see.
author: George William Russell

text: Like charity, I believe glamour should begin at home.
author: Loretta Young

text: How goodness heightens beauty!
author: Milan Kundera

text: Because beauty isn't enough, there must be something more.
author: Eva Herzigova

text: Taking joy in living is a woman's best cosmetic.
author: Rosalind Russell

text: Without realizing it, the individual composes his life according to the laws of beauty even in times of greatest distress.
author: Milan Kundera

text: I can't live without my beauty products. I love to be in my bathroom with my candles lit, morning, noon and night. I like taking hot baths and hot showers, using my body scrubs and lotions.
author: Traci Bingham

text: Beauty is one of the rare things which does not lead to doubt of God.
author: Jean Anouilh

text: I'd like to grow up and be beautiful. I know it doesn't matter, but it doesn't hurt.
author: Kirsten Dunst

text: My dad had this philosophy that if you tell children they're beautiful and wonderful then they believe it, and they will be. So I never thought I was unattractive. But I was never one of the girls at school who had lots of boyfriends.
author: Emily Mortimer

text: O human beauty, what a dream art thou, that we should cast our life and hopes away on thee!
author: Barry Cornwall

text: When everything else physical and mental seems to diminish, the appreciation of beauty is on the increase.
author: Bernard Berenson

text: I was not a good-lookin' girl. I was extremely skinny. I wasn't pretty. I wasn't cool.
author: Celine Dion

text: Beauty is only skin deep.
author: Thomas Overbury

text: You can't really say what is beautiful about a place, but the image of the place will remain vividly with you.
author: Tadao Ando

text: The plainer the dress, the greater luster does beauty appear.
author: Edward F. Halifax

text: Real beauty is to be true to oneself. That's what makes me feel good.
author: Laetitia Casta

text: It's sad when girls think they don't have anything going on except being pretty.
author: Keri Russell

text: There is hope and a kind of beauty in there somewhere, if you look for it.
author: H. R. Giger

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The beauty of a woman is not in a facial mode but the true beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It is the caring that she lovingly gives the passion that she shows. The beauty of a woman grows with the passing years.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Our task must be to free ourselves by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature and its beauty.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The beauty of a woman must be seen from in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: It is time for parents to teach young people early on that in diversity there is beauty and there is strength.
author: Maya Angelou

text: When I admire the wonders of a sunset or the beauty of the moon, my soul expands in the worship of the creator.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Education is the best friend. An educated person is respected everywhere. Education beats the beauty and the youth.
author: Chanakya

text: The beauty of a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries or the way she combs her hair.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Wisdom I know is social. She seeks her fellows. But Beauty is jealous, and illy bears the presence of a rival.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Beauty of whatever kind, in its supreme development, invariably excites the sensitive soul to tears.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: There is something terribly morbid in the modern sympathy with pain. One should sympathise with the colour, the beauty, the joy of life. The less said about life's sores the better.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Love is the beauty of the soul.
author: Saint Augustine

text: Beauty is how you feel inside, and it reflects in your eyes. It is not something physical.
author: Sophia Loren

text: Beauty without expression is boring.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Beauty without grace is the hook without the bait.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: We find delight in the beauty and happiness of children that makes the heart too big for the body.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It is cruel, you know, that music should be so beautiful. It has the beauty of loneliness of pain: of strength and freedom. The beauty of disappointment and never-satisfied love. The cruel beauty of nature and everlasting beauty of monotony.
author: Benjamin Britten

text: Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.
author: John Muir

text: Beauty is an outward gift, which is seldom despised, except by those to whom it has been refused.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: As we grow old, the beauty steals inward.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: A healthful hunger for a great idea is the beauty and blessedness of life.
author: Jean Ingelow

text: Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Beauty and femininity are ageless and can't be contrived, and glamour, although the manufacturers won't like this, cannot be manufactured. Not real glamour it's based on femininity.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: When I am working on a problem, I never think about beauty but when I have finished, if the solution is not beautiful, I know it is wrong.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

text: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.
author: Socrates

text: Beauty is the bait which with delight allures man to enlarge his kind.
author: Socrates

text: Loneliness adds beauty to life. It puts a special burn on sunsets and makes night air smell better.
author: Henry Rollins

text: The perception of beauty is a moral test.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: For every moment of triumph, for every instance of beauty, many souls must be trampled.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

text: Alas! how little does the memory of these human inhabitants enhance the beauty of the landscape!
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Poetry is the rhythmical creation of beauty in words.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
author: Rumi

text: Only on paper has humanity yet achieved glory, beauty, truth, knowledge, virtue, and abiding love.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
author: John Keats

text: It is not sufficient to see and to know the beauty of a work. We must feel and be affected by it.
author: Voltaire

text: Beauty is mysterious as well as terrible. God and devil are fighting there, and the battlefield is the heart of man.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

text: Enlightened leadership is spiritual if we understand spirituality not as some kind of religious dogma or ideology but as the domain of awareness where we experience values like truth, goodness, beauty, love and compassion, and also intuition, creativity, insight and focused attention.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: Anything in any way beautiful derives its beauty from itself and asks nothing beyond itself. Praise is no part of it, for nothing is made worse or better by praise.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.
author: Friedrich Schiller

text: I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of Beauty.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: I am a thing of beauty.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: The beauty, the poetry of the fear in their eyes. I didn't mind going to jail for, what, five, six hours? It was absolutely worth it.
author: Johnny Depp

text: Character contributes to beauty. It fortifies a woman as her youth fades. A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude, and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

text: Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: It is not so much for its beauty that the forest makes a claim upon men's hearts, as for that subtle something, that quality of air that emanation from old trees, that so wonderfully changes and renews a weary spirit.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

text: Beauty is the greatest seducer of man.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: I think permitting the game to become too physical takes away a little bit of the beauty.
author: John Wooden

text: Be sure what you want and be sure about yourself. Fashion is not just beauty, it's about good attitude. You have to believe in yourself and be strong.
author: Adriana Lima

text: A lot of us grow up and we grow out of the literal interpretation that we get when we're children, but we bear the scars all our life. Whether they're scars of beauty or scars of ugliness, it's pretty much in the eye of the beholder.
author: Stephen King

text: If truth is beauty, how come no one has their hair done in the library?
author: Lily Tomlin

text: Everyone has their own insecurities, regardless of how you look or how people perceive you, but sometimes people give their insecurities too much power. Defining beauty is simply a matter of opinion. For me, real beauty has very little to do with the structure of someone's face or body.
author: Devon Aoki

text: Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
author: Franz Kafka

text: It was one of those evenings when men feel that truth, goodness and beauty are one. In the morning, when they commit their discovery to paper, when others read it written there, it looks wholly ridiculous.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: It's not beauty but fine qualities, my girl, that keep a husband.
author: Euripides

text: What would be ugly in a garden constitutes beauty in a mountain.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Do you know the difference between a beautiful woman and a charming one? A beauty is a woman you notice, a charmer is one who notices you.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

text: Art is not the application of a canon of beauty but what the instinct and the brain can conceive beyond any canon. When we love a woman we don't start measuring her limbs.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: I'm just glad I was able to return to some of that innocence and beauty I had as a child when I started my own family, and my children brought me back some of that spirit.
author: Angelina Jolie

text: Great perils have this beauty, that they bring to light the fraternity of strangers.
author: Victor Hugo

text: The books that help you most are those which make you think that most. The hardest way of learning is that of easy reading but a great book that comes from a great thinker is a ship of thought, deep freighted with truth and beauty.
author: Pablo Neruda

text: The ideal and the beautiful are identical the ideal corresponds to the idea, and beauty to form hence idea and substance are cognate.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Whatever you may look like, marry a man your own age - as your beauty fades, so will his eyesight.
author: Phyllis Diller

text: What a man does for pay is of little significance. What he is, as a sensitive instrument responsive to the world's beauty, is everything!
author: H. P. Lovecraft

text: Celibacy is not just a matter of not having sex. It is a way of admiring a person for their humanity, maybe even for their beauty.
author: Timothy Radcliffe

text: The beauty is that through disappointment you can gain clarity, and with clarity comes conviction and true originality.
author: Conan O'Brien

text: Endurance is nobler than strength, and patience than beauty.
author: John Ruskin

text: Secrecy is the element of all goodness even virtue, even beauty is mysterious.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: Art can never exist without naked beauty displayed.
author: William Blake

text: Exuberance is beauty.
author: William Blake

text: It's a good thing that beauty is only skin deep, or I'd be rotten to the core.
author: Phyllis Diller

text: Sexiness wears thin after a while and beauty fades, but to be married to a man who makes you laugh every day, ah, now that's a real treat.
author: Joanne Woodward

text: Photography records the gamut of feelings written on the human face, the beauty of the earth and skies that man has inherited, and the wealth and confusion man has created. It is a major force in explaining man to man.
author: Edward Steichen

text: Most sets of values would give rise to universes that, although they might be very beautiful, would contain no one able to wonder at that beauty.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: There are no better cosmetics than a severe temperance and purity, modesty and humility, a gracious temper and calmness of spirit and there is no true beauty without the signatures of these graces in the very countenance.
author: Arthur Helps

text: Beauty is an ecstasy it is as simple as hunger. There is really nothing to be said about it. It is like the perfume of a rose: you can smell it and that is all.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

text: I can barely conceive of a type of beauty in which there is no Melancholy.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: That which you create in beauty and goodness and truth lives on for all time to come. Don't spend your life accumulating material objects that will only turn to dust and ashes.
author: Denis Waitley

text: A person however learned and qualified in his life's work in whom gratitude is absent, is devoid of that beauty of character which makes personality fragrant.
author: Hazrat Inayat Khan

text: Facts which at first seem improbable will, even on scant explanation, drop the cloak which has hidden them and stand forth in naked and simple beauty.
author: Galileo Galilei

text: Beauty in distress is much the most affecting beauty.
author: Edmund Burke

text: The beauty of independence, departure, actions that rely on themselves.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Beauty makes idiots sad and wise men merry.
author: George Jean Nathan

text: Look up, laugh loud, talk big, keep the color in your cheek and the fire in your eye, adorn your person, maintain your health, your beauty and your animal spirits.
author: William Hazlitt

text: Should you shield the canyons from the windstorms you would never see the true beauty of their carvings.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

text: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.
author: Francis Bacon

text: When I say that human beings are just gene machines, one shouldn't put too much emphasis on the word 'just.' There is a very great deal of complication, and indeed beauty in being a gene machine.
author: Richard Dawkins

text: It is the addition of strangeness to beauty that constitutes the romantic character in art.
author: Walter Hagen

text: Beauty may be skin deep, but ugly goes clear to the bone.
author: Redd Foxx

text: Beauty is in the eye of the beer holder.
author: Kinky Friedman

text: Teach us that wealth is not elegance, that profusion is not magnificence, that splendor is not beauty.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: I also became close to nature, and am now able to appreciate the beauty with which this world is endowed.
author: James Dean

text: In marriage do thou be wise: prefer the person before money, virtue before beauty, the mind before the body then thou hast a wife, a friend, a companion, a second self.
author: William Penn

text: That's one of the nice things. I mean, part of the beauty of me is that I'm very rich. So if I need $600 million, I can put $600 million myself. That's a huge advantage. I must tell you, that's a huge advantage over the other candidates.
author: Donald Trump

text: At fifteen, beauty and talent do not exist there can only be promise of the coming woman.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: Children, dear and loving children, can alone console a woman for the loss of her beauty.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: If in my youth I had realized that the sustaining splendour of beauty of with which I was in love would one day flood back into my heart, there to ignite a flame that would torture me without end, how gladly would I have put out the light in my eyes.
author: Michelangelo

text: A day spent without the sight or sound of beauty, the contemplation of mystery, or the search of truth or perfection is a poverty-stricken day and a succession of such days is fatal to human life.
author: Lewis Mumford

text: At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint or even remember it. It is enough.
author: Toni Morrison

text: Light, God's eldest daughter, is a principal beauty in a building.
author: Thomas Fuller

text: Beauty is about perception, not about make-up. I think the beginning of all beauty is knowing and liking oneself. You can't put on make-up, or dress yourself, or do you hair with any sort of fun or joy if you're doing it from a position of correction.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

text: That's why I began doing makeup in the first place: I was hoping that through helping people see the beauty in themselves, I could try and find it in me.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

text: Beauty is only skin deep. I think what's really important is finding a balance of mind, body and spirit.
author: Jennifer Lopez

text: When I tried to play something and screwed up, I'd hear some other note that would come into play. Then I started trying different things to find the beauty in it.
author: Dimebag Darrell

text: The most common error made in matters of appearance is the belief that one should disdain the superficial and let the true beauty of one's soul shine through. If there are places on your body where this is a possibility, you are not attractive - you are leaking.
author: Charles Lamb

text: The terrifying and edible beauty of Art Nouveau architecture.
author: Salvador Dali

text: O, thou art fairer than the evening air clad in the beauty of a thousand stars.
author: Christopher Marlowe

text: Through loyalty to the past, our mind refuses to realize that tomorrow's joy is possible only if today's makes way for it that each wave owes the beauty of its line only to the withdrawal of the preceding one.
author: Andre Gide

text: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Although beauty may be in the eye of the beholder, the feeling of being beautiful exists solely in the mind of the beheld.
author: Martha Beck

text: Beauty, to me, is about being comfortable in your own skin. That, or a kick-ass red lipstick.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

text: The human mind is capable of excitement without the application of gross and violent stimulants and he must have a very faint perception of its beauty and dignity who does not know this.
author: William Wordsworth

text: Beauty deprived of its proper foils and adjuncts ceases to be enjoyed as beauty, just as light deprived of all shadows ceases to be enjoyed as light.
author: John Ruskin

text: The kind of beauty I want most is the hard-to-get kind that comes from within - strength, courage, dignity.
author: Ruby Dee

text: Beauty for some provides escape, who gain a happiness in eyeing the gorgeous buttocks of the ape or Autumn sunsets exquisitely dying.
author: Langston Hughes

text: To give pain is the tyranny to make happy, the true empire of beauty.
author: Samuel Butler

text: The beauty of the world, which is so soon to perish, has two edges, one of laughter, one of anguish, cutting the heart asunder.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Every beauty which is seen here by persons of perception resembles more than anything else that celestial source from which we all are come.
author: Michelangelo

text: Beauty always promises, but never gives anything.
author: Simone Weil

text: To look almost pretty is an acquisition of higher delight to a girl who has been looking plain for the first fifteen years of her life than a beauty from her cradle can ever receive.
author: Jane Austen

text: Poets say science takes away from the beauty of the stars - mere globs of gas atoms. I, too, can see the stars on a desert night, and feel them. But do I see less or more?
author: Richard P. Feynman

text: We especially need imagination in science. It is not all mathematics, nor all logic, but it is somewhat beauty and poetry.
author: Maria Montessori

text: The architect should strive continually to simplify the ensemble of the rooms should then be carefully considered that comfort and utility may go hand in hand with beauty.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

text: It is art that makes life, makes interest, makes importance... and I know of no substitute whatever for the force and beauty of its process.
author: Henry James

text: It is dangerous for mortal beauty, or terrestrial virtue, to be examined by too strong a light. The torch of Truth shows much that we cannot, and all that we would not, see.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Poetry is something to make us wiser and better, by continually revealing those types of beauty and truth, which God has set in all men's souls.
author: James Russell Lowell

text: I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them.
author: Boris Pasternak

text: Taught from infancy that beauty is woman's sceptre, the mind shapes itself to the body, and roaming round its gilt cage, only seeks to adorn its prison.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

text: I tell myself that God gave my children many gifts - spirit, beauty, intelligence, the capacity to make friends and to inspire respect. There was only one gift he held back - length of life.
author: Rose Kennedy

text: Humanism was not wrong in thinking that truth, beauty, liberty, and equality are of infinite value, but in thinking that man can get them for himself without grace.
author: Simone Weil

text: Don't get me wrong, I admire elegance and have an appreciation of the finer things in life. But to me, beauty lies in simplicity.
author: Mark Hyman

text: Beauty is the disinterested one, without which the ancient world refused to understand itself, a word which both imperceptibly and yet unmistakably has bid farewell to our new world, a world of interests, leaving it to its own avarice and sadness.
author: Hans Urs von Balthasar

text: Courtesy is a silver lining around the dark clouds of civilization it is the best part of refinement and in many ways, an art of heroic beauty in the vast gallery of man's cruelty and baseness.
author: Bryant H. McGill

text: An artist is an artist only because of his exquisite sense of beauty, a sense which shows him intoxicating pleasures, but which at the same time implies and contains an equally exquisite sense of all deformities and all disproportion.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: San Francisco is a mad city - inhabited for the most part by perfectly insane people whose women are of a remarkable beauty.
author: Rudyard Kipling

text: Beauty is also submitted to the taste of time, so a beautiful woman from the Belle Epoch is not exactly the perfect beauty of today, so beauty is something that changes with time.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

text: A whopping 89 percent of buyers start their home search online. How your house looks online is the modern equivalent of 'curb appeal.' Rent a wide-angle lens and good lighting, get rid of your clutter and post at least eight great photos to win the beauty contest.
author: Barbara Corcoran

text: Sex and beauty are inseparable, like life and consciousness. And the intelligence which goes with sex and beauty, and arises out of sex and beauty, is intuition.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

text: There's a beauty to wisdom and experience that cannot be faked. It's impossible to be mature without having lived.
author: Amy Grant

text: Praise or blame has but a momentary effect on the man whose love of beauty in the abstract makes him a severe critic on his own works.
author: John Keats

text: Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
author: Franz Kafka

text: It would be difficult for me not to conclude that the most perfect type of masculine beauty is Satan, as portrayed by Milton.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: I am little concerned with beauty or perfection. I don't care for the great centuries. All I care about is life, struggle, intensity.
author: Emile Zola

text: Nonsense and beauty have close connections.
author: E. M. Forster

text: Beauty ought to look a little surprised: it is the emotion that best suits her face. The beauty who does not look surprised, who accepts her position as her due - she reminds us too much of a prima donna.
author: E. M. Forster

text: If we do not permit the earth to produce beauty and joy, it will in the end not produce food, either.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

text: I don't want to be perfect, but I do want to be a role model. My mom always tells me that imperfections equal beauty. All of us are imperfect.
author: Miley Cyrus

text: To me, teamwork is the beauty of our sport, where you have five acting as one. You become selfless.
author: Mike Krzyzewski

text: I decided that if I could paint that flower in a huge scale, you could not ignore its beauty.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

text: What the imagination seizes as beauty must be truth.
author: John Keats

text: With a great poet the sense of Beauty overcomes every other consideration, or rather obliterates all consideration.
author: John Keats

text: In chess one cannot control everything. Sometimes a game takes an unexpected turn, in which beauty begins to emerge. Both players are always instrumental in this.
author: Vladimir Kramnik

text: No spring nor summer beauty hath such grace as I have seen in one autumnal face.
author: John Donne

text: I believe that children are our future. Teach them well and let them lead the way. Show them all the beauty they possess inside.
author: Whitney Houston

text: The lover knows much more about absolute good and universal beauty than any logician or theologian, unless the latter, too, be lovers in disguise.
author: George Santayana

text: It is well known that Beauty does not look with a good grace on the timid advances of Humour.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

text: There is certainly no absolute standard of beauty. That precisely is what makes its pursuit so interesting.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

text: There is great beauty in going through life without anxiety or fear. Half our fears are baseless, and the other half discreditable.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

text: Grace in women has more effect than beauty.
author: William Hazlitt

text: Old hands soil, it seems, whatever they caress, but they too have their beauty when they are joined in prayer. Young hands were made for caresses and the sheathing of love. It is a pity to make them join too soon.
author: Andre Gide

text: There is nothing that makes its way more directly into the soul than beauty.
author: Joseph Addison

text: Competence, like truth, beauty, and contact lenses, is in the eye of the beholder.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: People say I'm extravagant because I want to be surrounded by beauty. But tell me, who wants to be surrounded by garbage?
author: Imelda Marcos

text: I always say you can never be extravagant with beauty. Beauty is God made real. Beauty is life.
author: Imelda Marcos

text: Grace is in garments, in movements, in manners beauty in the nude, and in forms. This is true of bodies but when we speak of feelings, beauty is in their spirituality, and grace in their moderation.
author: Joseph Joubert

text: I think everybody can agree that you can hear a certain song and it will put you in a certain mood, and that's just the beauty of music and I am so inspired by that.
author: Shaun White

text: Paris is one of the most beautiful places in all the world. Unfortunately, I was so homesick I couldn't appreciate its beauty.
author: Tyra Banks

text: The human soul needs actual beauty more than bread.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

text: For the man sound of body and serene of mind there is no such thing as bad weather every day has its beauty, and storms which whip the blood do but make it pulse more vigorously.
author: George Gissing

text: Who would not give up wit for power and beauty?
author: Mason Cooley

text: Enhance and intensify one's vision of that synthesis of truth and beauty which is the highest and deepest reality.
author: Ovid

text: The beautiful seems right by force of beauty, and the feeble wrong because of weakness.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: What is man's ultimate direction in life? It is to look for love, truth, virtue, and beauty.
author: Shinichi Suzuki

text: Beauty is desired in order that it may be befouled not for its own sake, but for the joy brought by the certainty of profaning it.
author: Tom Stoppard

text: The moment you cheat for the sake of beauty, you know you're an artist.
author: David Hockney

text: A thing is right when it tends to preserve the integrity, stability and beauty of the biotic community. It is wrong when it tends otherwise.
author: Aldo Leopold

text: A bad manner spoils everything, even reason and justice a good one supplies everything, gilds a No, sweetens a truth, and adds a touch of beauty to old age itself.
author: Baltasar Gracian

text: Beauty is the lover's gift.
author: William Congreve

text: There is in true beauty, as in courage, something which narrow souls cannot dare to admire.
author: William Congreve

text: A woman can be very beautiful and an ideal model and she will photograph incredibly well, but she'll appear in film and it won't work. What works is some fusion of physical beauty with some mental field or whatever you call it. I don't know.
author: Oliver Stone

text: The ideal beauty is a fugitive which is never found.
author: Joan Rivers

text: Wisdom is the abstract of the past, but beauty is the promise of the future.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

text: Our scientific age demands that we provide definitions, measurements, and statistics in order to be taken seriously. Yet most of the important things in life cannot be precisely defined or measured. Can we define or measure love, beauty, friendship, or decency, for example?
author: Dennis Prager

text: No matter what a woman's appearance may be, it will be used to undermine what she is saying and taken to individualize - as her personal problem - observations she makes about the beauty myth in society.
author: Naomi Wolf

text: Vampires have always held a very seductive kind of lore and have always been some variety of attractive, whether it's attractiveness that's born of just the physical attributes that they have - this kind of ethereal beauty or translucent pallor - or whether it is more to do with the way they carry themselves.
author: Colin Farrell

text: If you don't die of thirst, there are blessings in the desert. You can be pulled into limitlessness, which we all yearn for, or you can do the beauty of minutiae, the scrimshaw of tiny and precise. The sky is your ocean, and the crystal silence will uplift you like great gospel music, or Neil Young.
author: Anne Lamott

text: For what the horse does under compulsion, as Simon also observes, is done without understanding and there is no beauty in it either, any more than if one should whip and spur a dancer.
author: Xenophon

text: I might have some character traits that some might see as innocence or naive. That's because I discovered peace and happiness in my soul. And with this knowledge, I also see the beauty of human life.
author: Tobey Maguire

text: After all, it is the divinity within that makes the divinity without and I have been more fascinated by a woman of talent and intelligence, though deficient in personal charms, than I have been by the most regular beauty.
author: Washington Irving

text: Do not try to push your way through to the front ranks of your profession do not run after distinctions and rewards but do your utmost to find an entry into the world of beauty.
author: Sydney Smith

text: All cities are mad: but the madness is gallant. All cities are beautiful: but the beauty is grim.
author: Christopher Morley

text: Whether you come from heaven or hell, what does it matter, O Beauty!
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: People think that if you look fairly reasonable, you can't possibly act, and as I only care about acting, I think beauty can be a great handicap.
author: Vivien Leigh

text: Romance and novel paint beauty in colors more charming than nature, and describe a happiness that humans never taste. How deceptive and destructive are those pictures of consummate bliss!
author: Oliver Goldsmith

text: Always think of what is useful and not what is beautiful. Beauty will come of its own accord.
author: Nikolai Gogol

text: Beauty, like ice, our footing does betray Who can tread sure on the smooth, slippery way: Pleased with the surface, we glide swiftly on, And see the dangers that we cannot shun.
author: John Dryden

text: Filipinos want beauty. I have to look beautiful so that the poor Filipinos will have a star to look at from their slums.
author: Imelda Marcos

text: I have been overcome by the beauty and richness of our life together, those early mornings setting out, those evenings gleaming with rivers and lakes below us, still holding the last light.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

text: I was always reading those beauty magazines and wanting to become this unattainable thing.
author: Jennifer Aniston

text: I love Rauschenberg. I love that he created a turning point in visual history, that he redefined the idea of beauty, that he combined painting, sculpture, photography, and everyday life with such gall, and that he was interested in, as he put it, 'the ability to conceive failure as progress.'
author: Jerry Saltz

text: Abstraction brings the world into more complex, variable relations it can extract beauty, alternative topographies, ugliness, and intense actualities from seeming nothingness.
author: Jerry Saltz

text: In such ugly times, the only true protest is beauty.
author: Phil Ochs

text: During the 80s and 90s, we all became consumed with ourselves. In the 21st century, we've come back to simpler times. People are struggling economically and this has forced them to scale back the material aspects of their lives and realise the beauty of finding the simple joy in being with the people we love.
author: Julia Roberts

text: Beauty attracts us men but if, like an armed magnet it is pointed, beside, with gold and silver, it attracts with tenfold power.
author: Jean Paul

text: So much has been said and sung of beautiful young girls, why doesn't somebody wake up to the beauty of old women.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

text: In LA, where I live, it's all about perfectionism. Beauty is now defined by your bones sticking out of your decolletage. For that to be the standard is really perilous for women.
author: Alanis Morissette

text: Beauty is now defined by your bones sticking out of your decolletage. For that to be the standard is really perilous for women.
author: Alanis Morissette

text: Beauty will be convulsive or will not be at all.
author: Andre Breton

text: The pleasure we derive from the representation of the present is due, not only to the beauty it can be clothed in, but also to its essential quality of being the present.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: This is the beauty of the Qur'an: it asks you to reflect and reason, and not to worship the sun or moon but the One who has created everything. The Qur'an asks man to reflect upon the sun and moon and God's creation in general.
author: Cat Stevens

text: Poetry lifts the veil from the hidden beauty of the world, and makes familiar objects be as if they were not familiar.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

text: Obscenity, which is ever blasphemy against the divine beauty in life, is a monster for which the corruption of society forever brings forth new food, which it devours in secret.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

text: Everybody know, I don't do no promoting. I don't ever have to promote nothing, that's the beauty of Lil Wayne.
author: Lil Wayne

text: Whenever, at a party, I have been in the mood to study fools, I have always looked for a great beauty: they always gather round her like flies around a fruit stall.
author: Jean Paul

text: The first show I ever did, singing and dancing, was 'Beauty and the Beast.' I was playing Gaston. Gaston has red tights, knee high boots, and it's very physical. I had headaches every day for two months.
author: Hugh Jackman

text: A bachelor never quite gets over the idea that he is a thing of beauty and a boy forever.
author: Helen Rowland

text: Beauty and brains, pleasure and usability - they should go hand in hand.
author: Donald Norman

text: Smiling is definitely one of the best beauty remedies. If you have a good sense of humor and a good approach to life, that's beautiful.
author: Rashida Jones

text: The key to education is the experience of beauty.
author: Friedrich Schiller

text: Blues and soul and jazz music has so much pain, so much beauty of raw emotion and passion.
author: Christina Aguilera

text: Today I see beauty everywhere I go, in every face I see, in every single soul.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

text: Aging has a wonderful beauty and we should have respect for that.
author: Eartha Kitt

text: There are as many kinds of beauty as there are habitual ways of seeking happiness.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: The study of beauty is a duel in which the artist cries with terror before being defeated.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: Beauty is the sole ambition, the exclusive goal of Taste.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: Swift speedy time, feathered with flying hours, Dissolves the beauty of the fairest brow.
author: Lord Chesterfield

text: Beauty is that which is simultaneously attractive and sublime.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

text: I slept and dreamt that life was beauty I woke and found that life was duty.
author: George Byron

text: It's not some great work of beauty and love to be a rock-and-roll singer.
author: Robert Plant

text: The absence of flaw in beauty is itself a flaw.
author: Havelock Ellis

text: The true beauty of music is that it connects people. It carries a message, and we, the musicians, are the messengers.
author: Roy Ayers

text: Walk on a rainbow trail walk on a trail of song, and all about you will be beauty. There is a way out of every dark mist, over a rainbow trail.
author: Robert Motherwell

text: I have always known what I wanted, and that was beauty... in every form.
author: Joan Crawford

text: Liturgy is like a strong tree whose beauty is derived from the continuous renewal of its leaves, but whose strength comes from the old trunk, with solid roots in the ground.
author: Pope Paul VI

text: Beauty is merciless. You do not look at it, it looks at you and does not forgive.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

text: People often say that 'beauty is in the eye of the beholder,' and I say that the most liberating thing about beauty is realizing that you are the beholder. This empowers us to find beauty in places where others have not dared to look, including inside ourselves.
author: Salma Hayek

text: Beauty opened all the doors it got me things I didn't even know I wanted, and things I certainly didn't deserve.
author: Janice Dickinson

text: Soon I realized that if beauty equalled forgiveness, I was never going to be forgiven.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

text: By its very nature the beautiful is isolated from everything else. From beauty no road leads to reality.
author: Hannah Arendt

text: For all of nature's wonder and beauty, it is also hostile and unpredictable.
author: Liam Neeson

text: Beauty, whether moral or natural, is felt, more properly than perceived.
author: David Hume

text: Accuracy is, in every case, advantageous to beauty, and just reasoning to delicate sentiment. In vain would we exalt the one by depreciating the other.
author: David Hume

text: Filipinos don't wallow in what is miserable and ugly. They recycle the bad into things of beauty.
author: Imelda Marcos

text: Depression opens the door to beauty of some kind.
author: James Hillman

text: Somehow a bachelor never quite gets over the idea that he is a thing of beauty and a boy forever.
author: Helen Rowland

text: Beauty is not something you can count on. Usually, when people say you are beautiful, it is when there is a harmony between the inside and the outside.
author: Emmanuelle Beart

text: Pay attention to the beauty surrounding you.
author: Anne Lamott

text: I'm not ugly, but my beauty is a total creation.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

text: The beauty one can find in art is one of the pitifully few real and lasting products of human endeavor.
author: Paul Getty

text: Only when inspired to go beyond consciousness by some extraordinary insight does beauty manifest unexpectedly.
author: Arthur Erickson

text: I think exercise tests us in so many ways, our skills, our hearts, our ability to bounce back after setbacks. This is the inner beauty of sports and competition, and it can serve us all well as adult athletes.
author: Peggy Fleming

text: Ugliness is in a way superior to beauty because it lasts.
author: Serge Gainsbourg

text: I've never had any illusions about being a lead actor in films, because lead actors have to be of a certain kind. Apart from the beauty of looks and figure, which I cannot claim to have, there's just a particular kind of ordinary-Joe quality that a film star needs to have.
author: Stephen Fry

text: Let me tell you something - being thought of as a beautiful woman has spared me nothing in life. No heartache, no trouble. Love has been difficult. Beauty is essentially meaningless and it is always transitory.
author: Halle Berry

text: Beauty when unadorned is adorned the most.
author: St. Jerome

text: The 1990s, after the reign of terror of academic vandalism, will be a decade of restoration: restoration of meaning, value, beauty, pleasure, and emotion to art and restoration of art to its audience.
author: Camille Paglia

text: I believe that history has shape, order, and meaning that exceptional men, as much as economic forces, produce change and that passe abstractions like beauty, nobility, and greatness have a shifting but continuing validity.
author: Camille Paglia

text: Younger women have no problem in reconciling beauty with ambitions as a professional woman.
author: Camille Paglia

text: It seems like the chaos of this world is accelerating, but so is the beauty in the consciousness of more and more people.
author: Anthony Kiedis

text: I'm tired of all this nonsense about beauty being skin deep. That's deep enough. What do you want, an adorable pancreas?
author: Jean Kerr

text: Sometimes the beauty is easy. Sometimes you don't have to try at all. Sometimes you can hear the wind blow in a handshake. Sometimes there's poetry written right on the bathroom wall.
author: Ani DiFranco

text: A horse is a thing of beauty... none will tire of looking at him as long as he displays himself in his splendor.
author: Xenophon

text: I wasn't afraid of getting old, because I was never a great beauty.
author: Shirley MacLaine

text: Beauty is but the sensible image of the Infinite. Like truth and justice it lives within us like virtue and the moral law it is a companion of the soul.
author: George Bancroft

text: What matters poverty? What matters anything to him who is enamoured of our art? Does he not carry in himself every joy and every beauty?
author: Sarah Bernhardt

text: The pain passes, but the beauty remains.
author: Auguste Renoir

text: I always find beauty in things that are odd and imperfect - they are much more interesting.
author: Marc Jacobs

text: There is no racial or ethnic involvement in Thanksgiving, and people who may be very distant from the Christian system can see the beauty and the positive spirit that comes from the holiday.
author: John Clayton

text: But the gravest difficulty, and perhaps the most important, in poetry meant solely for recitation, is the difficulty of achieving verbal beauty, or rather of making verbal beauty tell.
author: Lascelles Abercrombie

text: You fall into my arms. You are the good gift of destruction's path, When life sickens more than disease. And boldness is the root of beauty. Which draws us together.
author: Boris Pasternak

text: Beyond the beauty, the sex, the titillation, the surface, there is a human being. And that has to emerge.
author: Jeanne Moreau

text: Most women are dissatisfied with their appearance - it's the stuff that fuels the beauty and fashion industries.
author: Annie Lennox

text: When I look at the majority of my own songs they really came from my own sense of personal confusion or need to express some pain or beauty - they were coming from a universal and personal place.
author: Annie Lennox

text: I mean, no one asks beauty secrets of me, or 'What size do you wear?' or 'Who's your couturier?' They ask me about really deep things and I love that.
author: Shirley MacLaine

text: Beauty is grace and confidence. I've learned to accept and appreciate what nature gave me.
author: Lindsay Lohan

text: I would rather be adorned by beauty of character than jewels. Jewels are the gift of fortune, while character comes from within.
author: Plautus

text: The truth, the absolute truth, is that the chief beauty for the theatre consists in fine bodily proportions.
author: Sarah Bernhardt

text: The human face is the organic seat of beauty. It is the register of value in development, a record of Experience, whose legitimate office is to perfect the life, a legible language to those who will study it, of the majestic mistress, the soul.
author: Eliza Farnham

text: It seems to me that the natural world is the greatest source of excitement the greatest source of visual beauty the greatest source of intellectual interest. It is the greatest source of so much in life that makes life worth living.
author: David Attenborough

text: Beauty is only skin deep, but it's a valuable asset if you're poor or haven't any sense.
author: Vernon Howard

text: There is little premium in poetry in a world that thinks of Pound and Whitman as a weight and a sampler, not an Ezra, a Walt, a thing of beauty, a joy forever.
author: Anna Quindlen

text: Death is the mother of Beauty hence from her, alone, shall come fulfillment to our dreams and our desires.
author: Wallace Stevens

text: The fame that goes with wealth and beauty is fleeting and fragile intellectual superiority is a possession glorious and eternal.
author: Sallust

text: I didn't appreciate the young woman that I was, or my young beauty, because I was so obsessed with the fact that I felt fat. It's never good to add to anybody else's suffering. It's an important topic to really get the gravity and the importance of - dealing with dignity.
author: Margaret Cho

text: A lot of punk rock is not going to be in the mainstream. It's below the radar. The beauty of it is that you're not supposed to always know. It's subterranean.
author: Billie Joe Armstrong

text: It's such a diversion to be constantly thinking of better ways I can teach people math that my hunger is for that really, for new ways of translating the beauty of it.
author: Danica McKellar

text: My beauty secret is absolutely no sun.
author: Vivienne Westwood

text: Standards of beauty are arbitrary. Body shame exists only to the extent that our physiques don't match our own beliefs about how we should look.
author: Martha Beck

text: Because, if one is writing novels today, concentrating on the beauty of the prose is right up there with concentrating on your semi-colons, for wasted effort.
author: Neil Gaiman

text: As soon as beauty is sought not from religion and love, but for pleasure, it degrades the seeker.
author: Annie Dillard

text: Beauty is an outward gift which is seldom despised, except by those to whom it has been refused.
author: Edward Gibbon

text: Beauty is often worse than wine intoxicating both the holder and beholder.
author: John Zimmerman

text: All the freaky people make the beauty of the world.
author: Michael Franti

text: I like to embrace natural beauty. I try to get at least 8 hours of sleep, drinking a lot of water and exercising.
author: Tia Mowry

text: I find beauty in the grotesque, like most artists.
author: Alexander McQueen

text: The past itself, as historical change continues to accelerate, has become the most surreal of subjects - making it possible... to see a new beauty in what is vanishing.
author: Susan Sontag

text: It is shallow people who think beauty is frivolous or excessive. If you are bringing beauty and god, you are enriching the country. Rice feeds the body, books feed the mind, beauty feeds the soul. It is one thing I can really be proud of and stand tall in the world.
author: Imelda Marcos

text: The only rich person is a person who is rich in spirit. I have no money deposit. I have only beauty deposit.
author: Imelda Marcos

text: Jordan has a strange, haunting beauty and a sense of timelessness. Dotted with the ruins of empires once great, it is the last resort of yesterday in the world of tomorrow. I love every inch of it.
author: King Hussein I

text: I am a great lover of art, in many forms: paintings, objets, textiles. I don't have the talent for painting, but I have a very good sense of colour, a love of visual beauty.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

text: Beauty is nature's brag, and must be shown in courts, at feasts, and high solemnities, where most may wonder at the workmanship.
author: John Milton

text: I pretty much borrow my entire beauty regime from my mom.
author: Rashida Jones

text: Ads featuring real women and real beauty are such a necessary component to offset the potentially dangerous programming out there for little girls.
author: Rashida Jones

text: The beauty of 'spacing' children many years apart lies in the fact that parents have time to learn the mistakes that were made with the older ones - which permits them to make exactly the opposite mistakes with the younger ones.
author: Sydney J. Harris

text: Strength of character may be learned at work, but beauty of character is learned at home.
author: Henry Drummond

text: I am still a victim of chess. It has all the beauty of art - and much more. It cannot be commercialized. Chess is much purer than art in its social position.
author: Marcel Duchamp

text: I do not know which to prefer, The beauty of inflections, Or the beauty of innuendoes, The blackbird whistling, Or just after.
author: Wallace Stevens

text: Beauty and the devil are the same thing.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

text: You can take no credit for beauty at sixteen. But if you are beautiful at sixty, it will be your soul's own doing.
author: Marie Stopes

text: Often, the roles I'm offered in England are melancholic women who are filled with regret for the past, regret for their fading beauty.
author: Kristin Scott Thomas

text: I am not fighting for success, just to get more beauty out of myself and share it with more people.
author: Ben Okri

text: Lila can't be a model until she's at least 21. She is already a mini-me - it is scary. She already has her own beauty kit.
author: Kate Moss

text: I would warn you that I do not attribute to nature either beauty or deformity, order or confusion. Only in relation to our imagination can things be called beautiful or ugly, well-ordered or confused.
author: Baruch Spinoza

text: I'm really proud of myself because I've pared my beauty regimen down to a cream blush and berry-tinted lip balm, which has saved me so much time.
author: Katherine Heigl

text: Wealth, beauty, and fame are transient. When those are gone, little is left except the need to be useful.
author: Gene Tierney

text: Italian men do appreciate beautiful women. They're not afraid of the beauty, which is nice.
author: Eva Herzigova

text: I want, of course, peace, grace, and beauty. How do you do that? You work for it.
author: Studs Terkel

text: Bracketing has turned all my experiences, remembered and present, into a gallery of miracles where I wander around dazzled by the beauty of events I cannot explain.
author: Martha Beck

text: Design is not making beauty, beauty emerges from selection, affinities, integration, love.
author: Louis Kahn

text: Beauty is a relation, and the apprehension of it a comparison.
author: Gerard Manley Hopkins

text: We come in many different shapes and sizes, and we need to support each other and our differences. Our beauty is in our differences.
author: Carre Otis

text: Her beauty didn't do her any good and she couldn't use it in any positive way or manipulative way. I just hope that people will look and see and believe in that hope of love, that hope of freedom, even if it was just for a limited time.
author: Diane Kruger

text: My everyday beauty routine is always rushed and pretty simple.
author: Cate Blanchett

text: Well, I've never looked upon myself as being a beauty, per se.
author: Cate Blanchett

text: After a decade this glum, we deserved a shot of 'Glee,' a show that restored our faith in the power of song, the beauty of dance, and the magic of 'spirit fingers' to chase our cares and woes into somebody else's backyard.
author: James Wolcott

text: Do not confuse beauty with beautiful. Beautiful is a human judgment. Beauty is All. The difference is everything.
author: Matthew Fox

text: Beauty is composed of an eternal, invariable element whose quantity is extremely difficult to determine, and a relative element which might be, either by turns or all at once, period, fashion, moral, passion.
author: Jean-Luc Godard

text: Fashion fosters cliches of beauty, but I want to tear them apart.
author: Miuccia Prada

text: When you are balanced and when you listen and attend to the needs of your body, mind, and spirit, your natural beauty comes out.
author: Christy Turlington

text: In art economy is always beauty.
author: Henry James

text: Through Kurt I saw the beauty of minimalism and the importance of music that's stripped down.
author: Dave Grohl

text: I trust in nature for the stable laws of beauty and utility. Spring shall plant and autumn garner to the end of time.
author: Robert Browning

text: I don't get anything for free. I pay for all my beauty treatments.
author: Jennifer Lopez

text: Rarely do great beauty and great virtue dwell together.
author: Petrarch

text: I didn't have any confidence in my beauty when I was young. I felt like a character actress, and I still do.
author: Meryl Streep

text: I really admire a woman for her intelligence, her personality. Beauty is not enough.
author: Roberto Cavalli

text: I write for no other purpose than to add to the beauty that now belongs to me. I write a book for no other reason than to add three or four hundred acres to my magnificent estate.
author: Jack London

text: They saw me, those reckless seekers of beauty, and in a night I was famous.
author: Lillie Langtry

text: Beauty is not just physical.
author: Halle Berry

text: Beauty and fullness of tone can be achieved by having the whole orchestra play with high clarinets and a carefully selected number of piccolos.
author: Gustav Mahler

text: I think the beauty of working with young people is they remind you of the spirit of acting and it's just a big play.
author: Eric Bana

text: I am obsessed with beauty. I want everything to be perfect, and of course it isn't. And that's a tough place to be because you're never satisfied.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

text: The beautiful seems right by force of beauty and the feeble wrong because of weakness.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

text: I would like to say to people, open your eyes and find beauty where you normally don't expect it.
author: Jean Paul Gaultier

text: Art is the unceasing effort to compete with the beauty of flowers - and never succeeding.
author: Gian Carlo Menotti

text: Thankfully, beauty is easier to remove than apply, and a swipe of demaquillage in the right direction and you are you once again.
author: Margaret Cho

text: Just because you are blind and unable to see my beauty doesn't mean it does not exist.
author: Margaret Cho

text: Order is the shape upon which beauty depends.
author: Pearl S. Buck

text: For the mind disturbed, the still beauty of dawn is nature's finest balm.
author: Edwin Way Teale

text: Women are so unforgiving of themselves. We don't recognize our own beauty because we're too busy comparing ourselves to other people.
author: Kelly Osbourne

text: But every great scripture, whether Hebrew, Indian, Persian, or Chinese, apart from its religious value will be found to have some rare and special beauty of its own and in this respect the original Bible stands very high as a monument of sublime poetry and of artistic prose.
author: Lafcadio Hearn

text: Part of the beauty of Judaism, and surely this is so for other faiths also, is that it gently restores control over time. Three times a day we stop what we are doing and turn to God in prayer. We recover perspective. We inhale a deep breath of eternity.
author: Jonathan Sacks

text: I've actually spent a lot of time researching beauty products, how they are produced and how they are sold.
author: Lauren Conrad

text: For I must tell you that we artists cannot tread the path of Beauty without Eros keeping company with us and appointing himself as our guide.
author: Thomas Mann

text: Solitude gives birth to the original in us, to beauty unfamiliar and perilous - to poetry. But also, it gives birth to the opposite: to the perverse, the illicit, the absurd.
author: Thomas Mann

text: What is sacred among one people may be ridiculous in another and what is despised or rejected by one cultural group, may in a different environment become the cornerstone for a great edifice of strange grandeur and beauty.
author: Hu Shih

text: Art is beauty, the perpetual invention of detail, the choice of words, the exquisite care of execution.
author: Theophile Gautier

text: I'm not one of those women who thinks beauty is a curse.
author: Diane Kruger

text: A lot of directors idealize their leading ladies or turn them into these objects of sexuality and beauty.
author: Diane Kruger

text: I like the idea of accessibility, coming from a lower-middle-class background myself, I feel like beauty and products should be accessible to all women over the world.
author: Diane Kruger

text: Beauty in art is often nothing but ugliness subdued.
author: Jean Rostand

text: What saddens me is the corruption of youth and beauty, and the loss of soul, which is only replaced by money.
author: Lisa Bonet

text: When I think of art I think of beauty. Beauty is the mystery of life. It is not in the eye it is in the mind. In our minds there is awareness of perfection.
author: Agnes Martin

text: The very definition of 'beauty' is outside.
author: Adam Carolla

text: I always loved aesthetics. Not particularly fashion, but an idea of beauty.
author: Miuccia Prada

text: Now, I'm not saying I'm fashionable, but there are sociological interests that matter to me, things that are theoretical, political, intellectual and also concerned with vanity and beauty that we all think about but that I try to mix up and translate into fashion.
author: Miuccia Prada

text: What sort of sap doesn't know by now that picture-perfect beauty is all done with smoke and mirrors anyway?
author: Julie Burchill

text: Shame, like beauty, is often in the eye of the beholder.
author: Julie Burchill

text: The truth of the matter is, beauty is a specific thing, rare and fleeting. Some of us have it in our teens, 20s and 30s and then lose it most of us have it not at all. And that's perfectly okay. But lying to yourself that you have it when you don't seems to me simple-minded at best and psychotic at worst.
author: Julie Burchill

text: What I find most upsetting about this new all-consuming beauty culture is that the obsession with good looks, and how you can supposedly attain them, is almost entirely female-driven.
author: Julie Burchill

text: Surely being a Professional Beauty - let alone an ageing one - is one of the most insecure and doomed careers imaginable.
author: Julie Burchill

text: I've always thought of beauty therapy, 'alternative' treatments and the like as the female equivalent of brothels - for essentially self-deceiving people who feel a bit hollow and have to pay to be touched.
author: Julie Burchill

text: These women whose antics we smirk at good-naturedly in the pap-traps put themselves out there at least partly on their beauty they are in showbiz, and showing what they've got is part of their business as much as it is for male show-ponies from the Chippendales to George Clooney.
author: Julie Burchill

text: Natural beauty takes at least two hours in front of a mirror.
author: Pamela Anderson

text: It is not the beauty of a building you should look at its the construction of the foundation that will stand the test of time.
author: David Allan Coe

text: One of the things that people don't realize is that that natural beauty, those recreational forests, they have an economic development impact for the state as well.
author: Ed Rendell

text: Endeavour to be faithful, and if there is any beauty in your thought, your style will be beautiful if there is any real emotion to express, the expression will be moving.
author: George Henry Lewes

text: Black beauty - he's a dark horse.
author: Tim Vine

text: I shall give you hunger, and pain, and sleepless nights. Also beauty, and satisfactions known to few, and glimpses of the heavenly life. None of these you shall have continually, and of their coming and going you shall not be foretold.
author: Howard Lindsay

text: People don't associate red hair, pale skin, and freckles with beauty.
author: Shirley Manson

text: I still believe that capitalism is too harsh and I believe that, even within that, there is a lot of satisfaction and beauty if you happen to be one of the lucky ones, although that doesn't eradicate the reality of the suffering. It's all true at once, kind of humming and sublime.
author: George Saunders

text: Physical beauty is such a strange thing.
author: Jock Sturges

text: I was kind of a jock in school. Beauty wasn't something I spent a lot of time on.
author: Nina Dobrev

text: I'm very accepting with my age. It's like notches on your belt: experience, wisdom, and a different kind of beauty. There comes a day when you've become comfortable in your skin.
author: Zoe Saldana

text: My wife has brought great beauty into my life. And my daughter has brought me nothing but joy. Those qualities were greatly lacking.
author: Christopher Meloni

text: My mother never put an emphasis on looks. She let us grow up on our own time line. She never forced any beauty regimen into my world.
author: Rachel McAdams

text: It is very necessary to have markers of beauty left in a world seemingly bent on making the most evil ugliness.
author: Thornton Wilder

text: Hollywood needs to recognise all shades of African American beauty.
author: Gabrielle Union

text: Editing yourself is like an irksome coin toss. You've got to strip yourself of super ego and operate from the id. Maybe I've got my Freud mixed up. It's just hard to trade a beauty shot for the performance with truth and a brightly lit zit.
author: Vera Farmiga

text: Beauty is a radiance that originates from within and comes from inner security and strong character.
author: Jane Seymour

text: I tried for a while to be an agricultural worker and was hopelessly bored. To me it was meaningless. I would stand around in heaps of manure and sings about the beauty of the work I wasn't doing.
author: Theodore Bikel

text: I tried for a while to be an agricultural worker and was hopelessly bored. I would stand around in heaps of manure and sing about the beauty of the work I wasn't doing.
author: Theodore Bikel

text: Art requires philosophy, just as philosophy requires art. Otherwise, what would become of beauty?
author: Paul Gauguin

text: I really like where Tony Robbins says that we're all hypnotized to see beauty this one specific way, and it's true.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

text: Beauty fades! I just turned 29, so I probably don't have that many good years left in me.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

text: Beauty, to me is about being comfortable in your own skin.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

text: You can't possibly fathom the ins and outs of a prepubescent beauty treatment until you've felt the strange but exhilarating tingle of a cottage-cheese-and-Pop-Rocks facial.
author: Sloane Crosley

text: As Ralph's character begins to discover the political thriller aspect of the film, he falls deeper in love with his wife, so the two run together. That's the beauty of this film. It has fast pace and excitement, but it also has heart and soul.
author: Rachel Weisz

text: Beauty can come in strange forms.
author: James Dyson

text: And I think of that again as I've written in several of my beauty books, a lot of health comes from the proper eating habits, which are something that - you know, I come from a generation that wasn't - didn't have a lot of food.
author: Joan Collins

text: Well I've written four beauty books as well.
author: Joan Collins

text: Bologna is the best city in Italy for food and has the least number of tourists. With its medieval beauty, it has it all.
author: Mario Batali

text: I think we have become obsessed with beauty and personally I'm really saddened by the way women mutilate their faces today in search of that.
author: Halle Berry

text: Beauty, more than bitterness, makes the heart break.
author: Sara Teasdale

text: I thought to be feminine was to give in to straight culture, or the beauty standard, but in my heart I had a flair for fashion and style. They were passions I kept secret because I didn't understand I could love clothes and hair and makeup and still like girls.
author: Beth Ditto

text: Thanks to capitalism, the importance placed on beauty has never been so manipulated. We are the guinea pigs force-fed ads that tell us how pathetic we are: that we will never be loved, happy or valuable unless we have the body, the face, the hair, even the personality that will apparently be ours, if only we buy their products.
author: Beth Ditto

text: She gave up beauty in her tender youth, gave all her hope and joy and pleasant ways she covered up her eyes lest they should gaze on vanity, and chose the bitter truth.
author: Christina Rossetti

text: I really like to be able to have variety and to try different things - that's the beauty of fashion.
author: Leighton Meester

text: Beauty is first and foremost an emotion.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

text: It's the beauty and curse of doing a daily show. Some days you've got nothing to talk about and other days Dick Cheney shoots his lawyer in the face and everyone is happy.
author: Craig Ferguson

text: The beauty that addresses itself to the eyes is only the spell of the moment the eye of the body is not always that of the soul.
author: George Sand

text: The trick of this thing and the beauty of this thing is that it's a cowboy movie first and then stuff happens. Even after stuff happens it doesn't change - it hasn't suddenly changed into another kind of movie. It's still a cowboy movie. And that's what's incredible about it because nobody has done that before, that's new territory.
author: Harrison Ford

text: With guys I revere, like Marcus Garvey or Malcolm X, their look is less about style than purpose and the expression of beauty. It wasn't just about being noticed, you know?
author: Mos Def

text: Who knows better than artists how much ugliness there is on the way to beauty, how many ghastly, mortifying missteps, how many days of granitic blockheadedness and dismaying ineptitude there is on the way to accomplishment, how partial all accomplishment is, how incomplete?
author: Tony Kushner

text: Every man who has shown the world the way to beauty, to true culture, has been a rebel, a 'universal' without patriotism, without home, who has found his people everywhere.
author: Chaim Potok

text: I discovered that the horse is life itself, a metaphor but also an example of life's mystery and unpredictability, of life's generosity and beauty, a worthy object of repeated and ever changing contemplation.
author: Jane Smiley

text: Beauty comes from a life well lived. If you've lived well, your smile lines are in the right places, and your frown lines aren't too bad, what more do you need?
author: Jennifer Garner

text: My mother is a big believer in being responsible for your own happiness. She always talked about finding joy in small moments and insisted that we stop and take in the beauty of an ordinary day. When I stop the car to make my kids really see a sunset, I hear my mother's voice and smile.
author: Jennifer Garner

text: The way in which mathematicians and physicists and historians talk is quite different, and what a physicist means by physical intuition and what a mathematician means by beauty or elegance are things worth thinking about.
author: Clifford Geertz

text: I know it sounds a bit corny, but I do think that beauty and sexiness come from within.
author: Rachel Stevens

text: I love the game, it's the greatest game on earth, that's why I can't understand all of this talk about trying to make the game better. People talk about the high strike zone and changing this and that. Why? To speed up the game? That's the beauty of baseball. There is no time element.
author: Eric Davis

text: Nothing surpasses the beauty and elegance of a bad idea.
author: Craig Bruce

text: Beauty is as relative as light and dark. Thus, there exists no beautiful woman, none at all, because you are never certain that a still far more beautiful woman will not appear and completely shame the supposed beauty of the first.
author: Paul Klee

text: Who among us has never looked up into the heavens on a starlit night, lost in wonder at the vastness of space and the beauty of the stars?
author: Jeb Bush

text: I am an unconventional beauty. I grew up in a high school where if you didn't have a nose job and money and if you weren't thin, you weren't cool, popular, beautiful. I was always told that I wasn't pretty enough to be on television.
author: Lea Michele

text: Our situation today shows that beauty demands for itself at least as much courage and decision as do truth and goodness, and she will not allow herself to be separated and banned from her two sisters without taking them along with herself in an act of mysterious vengeance.
author: Hans Urs von Balthasar

text: For me art and chess are closely related, both are forms in which the self finds beauty and expression.
author: Vladimir Kramnik

text: But I think it is a serious issue to wonder about the other platonic absolutes of say beauty and morality.
author: Roger Penrose

text: I was never an ambitious girl, or even a self-confident one. I never went in for beauty pageants or wore a stitch of make-up until I went to Los Angeles.
author: Pamela Anderson

text: What delights us in visible beauty is the invisible.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

text: There is a role and function for beauty in our time.
author: Tadao Ando

text: I like the beauty of Faulkner's poetry. But I don't like his themes, not at all.
author: Manuel Puig

text: You get more churches burned down in the United States in the last two years than in the last hundred, because of the lack of understanding of culture and diversity and the beauty of it.
author: Edward James Olmos

text: You, too, women, cast away all the cowards from your embraces they will give you only cowards for children, and you who are the daughters of the land of beauty must bear children who are noble and brave.
author: Giuseppe Garibaldi

text: All my writing is about the recognition that there is no single reality. But the beauty of it is that you nevertheless go on, walking towards utopia, which may not exist, on a bridge which might end before you reach the other side.
author: Marguerite Young
